CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 15, 1955, pg. 20, reads: "Tired of Waiting - Former Traffic Patrolman Leonard Brown, whom any will remember as having been the first Negro traffic patrolman to work the downtown area, grew tired of waiting for a promotion, so retired. This "Hero in Blue" currently operates a grocery store and meat market in Homestead District. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Leonard Brown wearing hat inscribed "Buy it today... Aunt Hannah's Bread", and apron, cutting large slab of meat with Toledo saw, in his grocery store and meat market, Homestead
